verses.verse: Thou shalt not sacrifice <S%H2076><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%>, or a sheep <S%H7716><s%>, wherein is a blemish <S%H3971><s%>, or anything evil <S%H7451><s%>; for that is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> unto Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%>.

and it be told <S%H5046><s%> thee <S%H8085><s%>, and thou hast heard of it <S%H1875><s%>, then shalt thou inquire diligently <S%H3190><s%>; and <S%H571><s%>, behold, if it be true, and the thing <S%H1697><s%> certain <S%H3559><s%>, that such abomination <S%H8441><s%> is wrought <S%H6213><s%> in Israel <S%H3478><s%>,

At the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of two <S%H8147><s%> witnesses <S%H5707><s%>, or three <S%H7969><s%> witnesses <S%H5707><s%>, shall he that is to die <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>; at the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of one <S%H259><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> he shall not be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.

So thou shalt put <S%H1197><s%> away <S%H1197><s%> the evil <S%H7451><s%> from the midst of thee <S%H7130><s%>.

If there arise a matter <S%H1697><s%> too hard <S%H6381><s%> for thee in judgment <S%H4941><s%>, between blood <S%H1818><s%> and blood <S%H1818><s%>, between plea <S%H1779><s%> and plea <S%H1779><s%>, and between stroke <S%H5061><s%> and stroke <S%H5061><s%>, being matters <S%H1697><s%> of controversy <S%H7379><s%> within thy gates <S%H8179><s%>; then shalt thou arise <S%H6965><s%>, and get thee up <S%H5927><s%> unto the place <S%H4725><s%> which Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> thy God <S%H430><s%> shall choose <S%H977><s%>;

And all the people <S%H5971><s%> shall hear <S%H8085><s%>, and fear <S%H3372><s%>, and do no more presumptuously <S%H2102><s%>.

thou shalt surely <S%H7760><s%> set <S%H7760><s%> him king <S%H4428><s%> over thee <S%H3068><s%>, whom Jehovah thy God <S%H430><s%> shall choose <S%H977><s%>: one from among <S%H7130><s%> thy brethren <S%H251><s%> shalt thou set <S%H7760><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> over thee <S%H3201><s%>; thou mayest not put <S%H5414><s%> a foreigner <S%H5237><s%> over thee <S%H251><s%>, who is not thy brother.

Only he shall not multiply <S%H7235><s%> horses <S%H5483><s%> to himself <S%H5971><s%>, nor cause the people to return <S%H7725><s%> to Egypt <S%H4714><s%>, to the end that he may multiply <S%H7235><s%> horses <S%H5483><s%>; forasmuch as Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath said <S%H559><s%> unto you <S%H3254><s%>, Ye shall henceforth return <S%H7725><s%> no more that way <S%H1870><s%>.

Neither shall he multiply <S%H7235><s%> wives <S%H802><s%> to himself <S%H3824><s%>, that his heart turn <S%H5493><s%> not away <S%H3966><s%>: neither shall he greatly multiply <S%H7235><s%> to himself silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%>.

And it shall be <S%H3427><s%>, when he sitteth upon the throne <S%H3678><s%> of his kingdom <S%H4467><s%>, that he shall write <S%H3789><s%> him a copy <S%H4932><s%> of this law <S%H8451><s%> in a book <S%H5612><s%>, out of that which is before <S%H6440><s%> the priests <S%H3548><s%> the Levites <S%H3881><s%>:

and it shall be with him <S%H7121><s%>, and he shall read therein all the days <S%H3117><s%> of his life <S%H2416><s%>; that he may learn <S%H3925><s%> to fear <S%H3372><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> his God <S%H430><s%>, to keep <S%H8104><s%> all the words <S%H1697><s%> of this law <S%H8451><s%> and these statutes <S%H2706><s%>, to do them <S%H6213><s%>;
